page.title: 12THE AVON AND STOUR VALLEYS
page.content: The majority of the land in the Christchurch area is fairly low and flat,indeed about 80% comes into this category. The highest point is St. Catherine's Hill which reaches a height of only 41.5 metres at its summit.The north-eastern side, which leads down to the Avon valley, is the steepest. The hill is about 2kms. long and 1 km. wide. In the Avon valley there are a large number of meanders and artificial drainage channels, which criss-cross the wide floodplain. The Stour valley to the west of the hill also has a wide floodplain but, unlike the Avon, has few drainage channels. Both valleys are used predominantly for the growing of grass , either as hay or pasture. The landuse changes southwards with an increase in the amount of the floodplain which is used for leisure.
